title: What led to the rise of the Ottoman Empire? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are some factors, so I should make a short list: Solid Organization: Ottoman Empire was built on a solid organization. In every aspects of a state, Ottomans were well-organized. Justice system, trading, politics, military, diplomacy, economy, everything was well organized. While it’s rivals were struggling with feudalism, Ottoman Empire was already optimized feudal structure to it’s benefit.Innovative State Mind: Ottoman Empire was only a Beylik once, which means a Principality. House of Ottomans were Oghuz Turks, who were Muslims but still very much Turkic, and they were progressive and innovative, until Selim I took Egypt and the title of Caliph with it. For example, Mehmed the Conqueror used huge cannons to bring down Constantinople’s unbreachable walls, while their rivals mostly using catapults and trebuchets. Also, Ottoman Army was one of the first armies that utilized firearms. So, Ottoman Empire was always one step ahead from their rivals.Geographically Lucky: Ottomans were luckier than most of other Turkish Beyliks, being neighbors with collapsing Byzantine Empire was a blessing for Ottomans. While their equals fought each other to death, Ottomans fought against “infidel” Byzantine, which made Ottomans favorite in jihadists eyes, and even other beyliks send troops to Ottomans to use Ottomans as a buffer between them and Byzantine threat. Ottomans used this force into perfection.Invincable manpower: Ottomans, once they conquered most of Anatolia and Greece, had the most manpower in both Balkans and Middle East. Plus they used Devshirme System to utilize non-Muslim boys. This manpower allowed Ottomans to resist even united Crusader armies by themselves. This manpower, combined with organized army structure, innovative rulers and Turkic warrior traditions, allowed Ottomans take Balkans one handedly.Strategic Invasions: Ottomans NEVER forced a region into submission after one war. If the region looks hardy and resistant, they always propose vassalizing them, and whether they accept or not, Ottomans vassalize them one way or another. Then they just place Turkish people and make locals get warm to Turkish traditions and rule, then Ottomans, when they feel like it’s time, they just integrate the vassal into empire. This tactic never disappointed Ottomans in history as I know.So these are the reasons I know about Ottoman rise. I hope you like it.
